article.headline: Binghamton 62, UMBC 59
article.story: VESTAL, N.Y. (AP) -- Reggie Fuller stole an inbounds pass with 3 seconds left, was fouled and made two free throws as Binghamton defeated Maryland-Baltimore County 62-59 on Saturday. A UMBC 3-point attempt bounced off the backboard at the buzzer. Fuller finished with 11 points and 12 rebounds for the Bearcats (8-10, 4-2 America East), who have won their last six home games. Binghamton led 29-18 at halftime and went up 36-18 2 minutes into the second half, when the Retrievers (12-6, 4-1) went on a 15-3 run. Darryl Proctor finished with 18 points for UMBC while Ray Barbosa added 14 and Brian Hodges 12. UMBC led 59-56 with 48 seconds remaining, but Lazar Trifunovic made two free throws for the Bearcats, who quickly fouled Hodges. He missed the front end of a 1-and-1. After a timeout, Trifunovic's jump-hook gave Binghamton a 60-59 lead with 7 seconds to play. Trifunovic scored 12 points and Mike Gordon and Dwayne Jackson both had 11.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
